page.title: 08The Gayton Nature Reserve
page.content: The Gayton Nature Reserve was created by a local businessman in 1978 on the site of an old brick works and quarry just outside Gayton on the road to Milton Malsor (next to "The Limes"). In seven years it has almost doubled in size. It now includes many acres of water and the 3 kilometre stretch of disused railway track between Gayton and Tiffield. The ponds and lakes were all dug by the owner to provide many different habitats which were soon naturally colonised by a variety of plants and animals. A few were introduced by the owner but he tried to keep the growth as natural as possible. At the moment the nature reserve is not open to the public, but interested groups can make their own arrangements.
